title: Guidance
content:
I am a 2nd year computer science student and as a part of my curriculum I have DSA,OS, Computer networks and as a side learning component I've learnt supervised, unsupervised,ANNs and now exploring computer vision and image processing for robotics and healthcare.
1. Nowadays I find it difficult to balance and choose between developing and honing my existing course knowledge (DSA,OS,CN) or get my hands on work by working on projects of AI/ML.

2. What would one choose to do in the upcoming summer if they were in my position? Take up and internship in ML domains or improve upon DSA ,OS,WEB dev?

Note:nsorry if there are any grammatical mistakes, just need guidance.Hoping someone who has cleared this stage and is working now guides me thru.
Thanks in advance!!

comments.body:
Yeah started but yet to become a pro,
Will keep this in mind
Thank you!

Do you have any domain in CS you are fascinated by or interested in? Learn whatever you want to in that domain. Build a project from whatever you learnt. Make it so good that you are proud of it and you *want* to put it on your resume. 

Most importantly take a break. Vacations are for calming down first and improving yourself second.

Yeah I am interested in ML (not bcz of the ongoing hype, actually interested) and I am working on a project right now.
Just needed guidance about a choice to make for the upcoming summer, bcz I do lack a lot in competitive programming.

Yeah thanks a lot!!,I'll keep that in mind and try to balance btw having a vacation and learning

Good luck with your project. 

W.r.t competitive programming hone your problem solving skills before any language specific skills (like list comprehension in python or memory management in C/C++)

Thank you!!
Ohh cool yeah,I'll keep that in mind.
Do you recommend any YT playlist to get started with competitive programming and concepts or just go ahead with solving,(the websites scare me a lot tbh and i end up losing interest)?
Ahh I didn't really watch any videos so can't give any help there sorry. Make a post someone will probably reply.

Cool cool,no worries 
Anyways thanks a lot for the help!
